source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Branches of inflorescence with terminal and lateral racemes; nodes of culm virtually glabrous; leaf-blades 5 mm wide or more; weedy, chiefly of northern irrigated areas
Branches of inflorescence with terminal racemes only; nodes of culm ringed by long spreading hairs; leaf-blades less than 5 mm wide; uncommon, of drier areas in East Gippland
